result.execSummary:
The defendant Aaron Mark Barr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Aaron Mark Barr is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Aaron Mark Barr was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Aaron Mark Barr was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Statutory costs assessed.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically domestic violence counseling, anger management counseling, and AODA assessment, treatment and after care. No violent contact with the victim. Must continue to pay child support. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on probation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Aaron Mark Barr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Does not plan to seek postconviction relief.

Defendant Aaron Mark Barr in court with attorney Carolyn Hillery Delery.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer. The State files an amendded information. Defense acknowledges receipt and waives reading of same; NG plea entered. The State is in compliance with Ch. 950. Upon plea to Cts 1 & 4. Cts 2 & 3 are dismissed outright. The State recommends w/held sent; 18 mos prob - conditions some time in RCJ, no violent contact, FT emp.
P-NC to Ct 1, G to Ct 4
COP filed, rights given
the deft waives right to JT - the State stipulates
the State relies on comp for FB - defense stipulates to same
finding of guilt

BTC: guilty as above. Sent w/held - 18 mos prob

Conditions:
RCJ=CFTS
obey all rules and regs
costs - 60 dtp
DNA costs - 60 dtp
no alc/cs except by Rx-UA's authorized
any counseling deemed approp by agent; specifically domestic violence counseling and anger management counseling as well as AODA assessment, treatment and after care
no violent contact with the victim
continue to pay child support
Plea hearing on June 2, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 22, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Aaron Mark Barr in court with attorney Carolyn Hillery Delery.  Defendant Aaron Mark Barr in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.
Matter is continued from 4/2/15. 
Comm. Simanek informs that court that he has had an opportunity to review the transcript from the previous prem. hearing. 
State calls Officer Hetland, DSAT 
State moves for bind over. Defense objects. 
Defense requests bond modification. State objects. 
BTC:   Testimony given, probable cause found,  bound over. Bond modification is denied.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Status conference on April 9, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Aaron Mark Barr in court with attorney Carolyn Hillery Delery.  Defendant Aaron Mark Barr in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Transcript filed:4-6-2015 ds.
States witness was not served.
Defense requests time limits to not be waived and wants the hearing to proceed today. 
Defense is responsible for the transcript to be delivered to the court official presiding next week 
Defense calls J. Christensen, DSAT
State requests a colloquy of the witness. 
Comm. informs the witness that she has a right to invoke the 5th amendment, once she does that she must do it for all questions thereafter. 
Defense requests bond modification. State objects. 
BTC: Matter is adjourned for one week. Bond modification is denied. 
  Status conference scheduled for April 9, 2015 at 09:00 am.
for no contact an order rescinding defendant's telephone, visitation, and US mail custody privileges
Preliminary hearing on April 2, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Aaron Mark Barr in court with attorney Carolyn Hillery Delery.  Defendant Aaron Mark Barr in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.
State informs the court that he has advised the witness to obtain counsel. State informed witness the reprecussions of perjury. 
State requests a one week adjournment. Defense objects. 
Comm. Rudebusch informs the witness she needs to speak w/private counsel. 
Defense requests bond modification. State objects and makes note that the no contact includes the victim to not contact the family of the Defendant. 
BTC: Matter is adjourned.  Finding of good cause to waive time limits. Bond modification is denied.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 2, 2015 at 09:00 am.

$500.00 cash bond posted on 2/21/15

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the victim, JC (person, property, residence or family).   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.   Defendant is ordered to have SCRAM unit installed and monitored by Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) - 524 S. Main Street, 3rd floor (262-632-1780.  $208 advanced fee for installment of SCRAM must be paid prior to release from jail. Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Aaron Mark Barr in court with attorney Mindy M. Nolan.  Robin K. Green appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.
Defense moves to dismiss CT 3 based upon lack of probable cause. 
BTC: Motion to dismiss CT 3 is denied .  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set. DEFENDANT TAKEN INTO CUSTODY.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
